    NetworkÂ¶

    Note

    This module provides methods for network analysis. The are integrated in the CatmaProject and AnnotationCollection class.

    class Network(annotation_collections: typing.List[gitma.annotation_collection.AnnotationCollection], character_distance: int = 100, edge_func: str = 'cooccurrent', included_tags: typing.Optional[list] = None, excluded_tags: typing.Optional[list] = None, level: str = 'tag', network_layout: callable = <function kamada_kawai_layout>)Â¶

    Bases: object

    Class to draw annotation coocurrence network graphs.

    Parameters

    • annotation_collections (List[AnnotationCollection]) â List of included annotation collections.

    • character_distance (int, optional) â Cooccurrence span. Defaults to 100.

    • edge_func (str, optional) â Keyword for the function that identifies connected annotations. Either 'cooccurent' or 'overlapping'. Defaults to cooccurrent_annotations.

    • included_tags (list, optional) â Included tags. If None and excluded_tags None all tags are included. Defaults to None.

    • excluded_tags (list, optional) â Excluded tags. Defaults to None.

    • level (str, optional) â Whether the annotations tag or the values of the given property gets included.

    • network_layout (callable, optional) â NetworkX Drawing Layout. Defaults to nx.drawing.layout.kamada_kawai_layout.

    The edge function.

    The annotation level.

    Merged annotationd dataframe

    edgesÂ¶

    List of edge objects.

    network_graphÂ¶

    The networkX graph object.

    The node position

    to_gexf(filename: str = 'catma_network', directory: str = './') â NoneÂ¶

    Writes Network Graph to a GEPHI xml file.

    Parameters

    • filename (str, optional) â The name of the gexf file. Defaults to âcatma_networkâ.

    • directory (str, optional) â The fileâs directory. Defaults to â./â.

    stats() â pandas.core.frame.DataFrameÂ¶

    Creates network stats data frame.

    Returns

    degree, weighted_degree, betweenness centrality, weighted betweenness centrality

    Return type

    pd.DataFrame

    plot(node_size: str = 'weighted_degree', node_factor: float = 100.0, node_alpha: int = 15, plot_stats: bool = False)Â¶

    Plots network as plotly graph.

    Parameters

    • node_size (str, optional) â Which network metric to use as node size. Defaults to âbetweennessâ.

    • node_factor (float, optional) â Customize the node size. Defaults to 100.0.

    • node_alpha (int, optional) â Minimal node size. Defaults to 3.

    • plot_stats (bool, optional) â Whether to plot the stats as pandas.DataFrame. Defaults to True.
